other_tests.findings: Normal results; brother was confirmed seizure-free.
Absence of slow-wave sleep and reduced amounts of REM sleep, without any evidence of central or obstructive apnea.
Clinical suspicion of ADNFLE confirmed; DNA sequencing showed the presence of serine 284 to leucine mutation in the CHRNa4 gene.
Multiple events during stage 2 sleep occurred on average every 60 seconds, lasting on average 6-8 seconds; similar in nature to prior seizures.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Frequent seizures led to a paucity of slow-wave sleep and complete absence of REM sleep.

other_tests.findings: Almost complete resolution of clinical and electrical events; increase in duration of slow-wave sleep and REM sleep.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient reported improved sleep and less anxiety two weeks later.
